title: Energy - Distance block slides after track

content.question: A block is released from rest and slides down a track with negligible friction, descending a vertical distance of <math alttext="5.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> from its initial position to Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. The block then slides on a horizontal surface where the coefficient of kinetic friction <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Î¼</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></math> between the block and the horizontal surface is <math alttext="0.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn></math>. How far does the block slide on the horizontal surface before coming to rest?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.0 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="5.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="10 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>
<math alttext="25 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="25 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
